duplicates.evidence: All three PRs by author w0s1nsk1, targeting voice-call channel, submitted within 40 minutes (2026-02-06 15:16:43 to 16:21:07). PR #10488 and #10520 have identical titles ('voice-call: add asterisk-ari provider + fix ExternalMedia cleanup'). Likely iterative resubmissions of same work in response to rejections or feedback. PR #10481 is narrow fix ('avoid orphaned UnicastRTP and ensure ExternalMedia cleanup') while #10488 and #10520 combine fix + feature. Pattern suggests author attempting multiple variations of asterisk-ari provider work. High probability these are duplicates/supersessions rather than independent submissions.

Weak potential overlap: PR #15701 (agents category, file_path alias) and PR #16645 (docs/scripts, automated backup) target different components and have different authors (rodrigouroz vs jleechan2015). No evidence of duplication; low confidence link. Included for completeness but unlikely to be duplicates.

Both PRs address zip/archive path traversal security hardening. PR#3687 titled 'fix(security): harden zip extraction path validation' and PR#5322 titled 'Infra: block zip path traversal during archive extraction'. Same security issue (path traversal in zip/archive extraction), overlapping fix scope. Both first-time contributors, created 2 days apart (Jan 29 vs Jan 31). Likely independent submissions solving same vulnerability. PR#3687 focuses on extraction validation, PR#5322 on infrastructure/docker context. Likely superseding pair with PR#5322 (later, infrastructure-focused) potentially superseding PR#3687 (earlier, generic security focus).

Identical titles ('perf(gateway): reduce idle CPU by increasing config/manifest cache TTL to 5s'), same author (VintLin), created 7 minutes apart (2026-02-08T02:52:10Z vs 02:58:35Z).
